page.title: 18 LOCAL TRANSPORT
page.content: THe roads in Gloucestershire were very bad before turnpike roads like the A.38 were built (1764).Bulky goods were taken by the River Severn in barges called{SEVERN TROWS}.The railways came in the 1840's but passed to the east of the area.The nearest stations were Gloucester, Cheltenham and Tewkesury. Traffic returned to the A.38 main road in the 1920's and 30's and became very heavy by 1960. Traffic jams used to extend 5 to 10 miles on either side of Tewkesbury during summer weekends and the locals said that some women were able to get out of a car and do some shopping and meet their husbands only a little way down the High Street. The M.5. Motorway opened in the early 70's took most of the through traffic away from the main road.
